body: I couldn’t bear to see her, even if I would never figure out why exactly she had done this. I slapped my laptop down, shoving it into my backpack by my feet before haphazardly half-zipping it up. I left the paper there. I had to go.

I glanced at the coffee shop one last time, but didn’t see her anywhere nearby. Adjusting my backpack mid-stride, I pivoted down the main hallway, my eyes locked on the main entrance. I couldn’t manage to breathe, picking up the pace in turn like I was on the edge of passing out. I looked past the blurry front desk, so close to the crisp night--
